verses.text: 給以弗所教會的信「你要寫信給在以弗所教會的使者，說：『那右手拿著七星，在七個金燈臺中間行走的，這樣說：

words.note: Lit. 'teaching assembly'
Can refer to a human messenger or an angelic being.

verses.text: 我知道你的行為、你的勞苦、你的忍耐，也知道你不能容忍惡人。你也曾經試驗那些自稱是使徒，而其實不是使徒的人，看出他們是假的。

words.note: Often refers to hard work or suffering for a cause.
Implies a formal or thorough testing.
Lit. 'sent disciple'

verses.text: 你有忍耐，曾為我的名的緣故忍受一切，並不困倦。
然而有一件事我要責備你，就是你已經離棄了你起初的愛。

words.note: Here '備' implies fully laying out the blame.

verses.text: 所以，你應當回想你是從哪裡墜落的，並且要悔改，作起初所作的事。你若不悔改，我就要來到你那裡，把你的燈臺從原處移去。

words.note: Lit. 'regret and change'
Used to mark the object of a verb.

verses.text: 不過你有這一個優點，就是你恨惡尼哥拉黨的作為，那也是我所恨惡的。

words.note: Often used in a strong moral or religious sense.
A group mentioned in Revelation, likely a transliteration with 'party/faction' suffix.
Often found in classical Chinese and religious texts.

verses.text: 聖靈向眾教會所說的話，有耳的就應當聽。得勝的，我必定把 神樂園裡生命樹的果子賜給他吃。』

words.note: Lit. 'holy spirit'.
Often written with a raised '示' radical in the Bible to show reverence.

verses.text: 給士每拿教會的信「你要寫信給在士每拿教會的使者，說：『那首先的、末後的、曾經死去而又活過來的，這樣說：

words.note: Ancient city in Asia Minor, now Izmir, Turkey.
Refers to God or Christ as the beginning.
Refers to God or Christ as the end.

verses.text: 我知道你的患難和貧窮，但你卻是富足的。我也知道那些自稱是猶太人所說毀謗的話，其實他們不是猶太人，而是撒但的黨徒。

words.note: Lit. 'Judea people', referring to the inhabitants of Judea or descendants of Jacob/Israel.
Transliteration of Hebrew 'Satan', meaning 'adversary'.
Implies a strong allegiance, often negative.

verses.text: 你不要怕你將要受的苦。看哪！魔鬼將要把你們中間幾個人下在監裡，叫你們受試煉，你們要受患難十天。你要忠心至死，我就把那生命的冠冕賜給你。

words.note: An exclamation common in biblical texts, often introducing important statements.
Refers to a process of testing or refinement, often through hardship.
Refers to a victor's wreath or royal crown, a symbol of honor or triumph.

verses.text: 聖靈向眾教會所說的話，有耳的就應當聽。得勝的，決不會受第二次死的害。』

words.note: Lit. 'holy spirit'.
Used before a verb to form a noun phrase.
Indicates a modifying relationship, similar to '-ed' or 'who/which'.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '有耳' (has ears).
A key concept in Revelation.
Nominalizes '得勝' to mean 'the one who overcomes'.
Often used with a negative, e.g., '決不會' (definitely not).

verses.text: 給別迦摩教會的信「你要寫信給在別迦摩教會的使者，說：『那有一把兩刃利劍的，這樣說：

words.note: Indicates obligation or strong intent.
In Revelation, often refers to an angel (or human representative).
Nominalizes the preceding phrase to mean 'the one who has a sharp, two-edged sword'.

verses.text: 我知道你居住的地方，就是撒但王座所在的地方。當我忠心的見證人安提帕在你們那裡，就是在撒但居住的地方被殺的那些日子，你還持守我的名，沒有否認對我的信仰。

words.note: Indicates location of something.
Implies perseverance and adherence.

verses.text: 然而有幾件事我要責備你，因為在你那裡有些人持守巴蘭的教訓。這巴蘭曾經教導巴勒把絆腳石放在以色列人面前，叫他們吃祭過偶像的食物，並且行淫亂。

words.note: To lay blame or admonish.
Implies perseverance and adherence.
Indicates the object is acted upon or moved.
Indicates something has been offered as a sacrifice.

verses.text: 同樣，你也有些人持守尼哥拉黨的教訓。

words.note: Implies perseverance and adherence.

verses.text: 所以，你應當悔改；如果不悔改，我就很快地來到你們那裡，用我口中的劍跟他們作戰。

words.note: A key concept in Christian theology.

verses.text: 聖靈向眾教會所說的話，有耳的就應當聽。得勝的，我必定把那隱藏的嗎哪賜給他，並且賜他一塊白石，石上寫著新的名字，這名字除了那領受的人以外，是沒有人能知道的。』

words.note: Refers to the third person of the Christian Trinity.
Often used in biblical contexts (e.g., 'all the churches').
Lit. 'teaching assembly'.
Used before a verb to form a nominal phrase, like 'that which is said'.
Turns 'one who has ears' into a noun phrase.
A frequent term in Revelation.
Turns 'one who overcomes' into a noun phrase.
Introduces the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.
A miraculous food provided to the Israelites in the wilderness.
Often used for divine or royal grants.
Symbolic in Revelation, possibly representing acquittal or privilege.
Often used in religious contexts for receiving divine gifts or teachings.
Emphasizes the certainty or quality of the statement.

verses.text: 給推雅推拉教會的信「你要寫信給在推雅推拉教會的使者，說：『 神的兒子，那眼睛像火燄、兩腳像光銅的，這樣說：

words.note: One of the seven churches of Asia mentioned in Revelation.
In Revelation, often refers to an angel or the leader of a church.
Refers to the Christian God.
Describes a radiant, polished bronze appearance.
Turns the preceding descriptive phrase into a noun phrase, 'the one whose eyes...'

verses.text: 我知道你的行為，你的愛心、信心、服侍和忍耐，也知道你後來所作的比先前的還要多。

words.note: Lit. 'loving heart'.
Lit. 'trusting heart'.
Often refers to service in a religious or respectful context.

verses.text: 然而有一件事我要責備你，就是你容讓那自稱是先知的婦人耶洗別，教導和引誘我的眾僕人行淫亂，吃祭過偶像的食物。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
A queen infamous for idolatry and wickedness in the Old Testament.
Often refers to followers or disciples of God/Christ.
Refers to sexual immorality.
Implies food offered to idols.

verses.text: 我曾給她時間，讓她悔改，她卻不肯為她的淫行悔改。
看哪，我要把她拋在大患難的床上；那些跟她行淫亂的人，如果不為她的行為悔改，我也要把他們拋在大患難中。

words.note: Commonly used in the Bible to draw attention.
Used to prepose direct objects in a V-O sentence.

verses.text: 我必以死亡擊殺她的兒女；眾教會就都知道我是察驗人肺腑心腸的，我要照著你們的行為報應你們各人。

words.note: An idiom referring to one's deepest thoughts and emotions.

verses.text: 至於你們其餘在推雅推拉的人，就是不跟從那教訓，不認識所謂撒但深奧的事的人，我告訴你們，我不會把別的重擔放在你們身上。
不過，你們要持守已經得著的，直到我來。
得勝的，又遵守我的旨意到底的，我必把統治列國的權柄賜給他，

words.note: Often refers to God's will.

verses.text: 他必用鐵杖治理他們，好像打碎陶器一樣粉碎他們，
好像我從父領受了權柄一樣；我還要把晨星賜給他。

words.note: A title for Jesus in Revelation.

verses.text: 聖靈向眾教會所說的話，有耳的就應當聽。』」

words.definition: what is said, that which is spoken

words.note: Implies spiritual understanding, not just physical hearing.
